author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
As you can see here:
pw-adapted-complementary-builds-special ... 5-s10.html
we're trying to set up a very good build with max AB.

Here's a recap:
Cornflower wrote:
Thorsson wrote: Looking at the AA, I have a couple of questions:

1. Why Knockdown? Seems a pointless Feat on an AA with 14 Str.
2. Why not get 29 AA levels for the maximum bonus (or even 30 as you get a Bonus Feat)?
3. Although you lose the extra Dex and full Elf abilities, Half-Elf allows you to take Bard, which gives you full Tumble and UMD, as well as Bard Song (which gets you back the AB you lost on Dex, plus some damage).

I guess I'm thinking of something along the lines of F8/Bd3/AA29 or Bd4/F6/AA30.

TBH is the Rapier stuff worth having? I mean he's not going to hurt a fly with one. Certainly not a boss with DR.
1. I have no idea, as I said I just got the build and tried it. I'm open to improvements if anyone would like to set it up.
2. See above.
3. I understand the thinking of bard, but why drop Elf? You can be an elven bard.

Rapier is I think more of a convenience so you can go rapier/shield when it's crowded and you can't move back and fire undisturbed. It's not a necessity I think, but so far (lvl 22) I find it useful.

Thinking of the suggested build... You want bard 3 for the song. Bard 4 doesn't really give you anything extra (possibly 2 lvl 2 spells, if you spend enough charisma, which you won't). You want AA29 for the max bonus. The extra D6 explosive damage you get from AA30 is probably not very useful. So, Fighter 8/Bard 3/AA29 would probably be best. (If not, please explain why).

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
OK. Tried to set up a build. Since you can only take 10 levels of AA pre-epic, the question is: Do you want more than one level of Fighter post-epic for epic feats, if so, which?
I'm thinking you take a fighter level post-epic, then you can get Epic Weapon Specialization. But, then you can't use Bard level for Tumble/UMD skill dump. If you drop one AA level, you can just the same drop two, since 28 and 27 have the same bonus.

So, what's better? EWS / Tumble+UMD maxed out / Drop one AA levels / Drop two AA levels and get both EWS and Tumble+UMD?

I think your reasoning is sound.

You only need 40 Tumble. I don't think you need 43 UMD either, so Bard doesn't have to wait all the way until 40 (could be 37), although you probably squeeze one more Save vs spells from it. Not keen on the Will Save anyway, but maybe that is covered off through items.

I had said Half-Elf, because Elf gets an XP Penalty, but that might not be important. 

I wonder if more Bard might be helpful, e.g. Bd9/F4/AA27; assuming that you can get WS/EWS on the 4th Fighter level, it would be Bd7/F3/AA10 pre-Epic. Obviously you lose 3 Feats (bye bye Rapier I think). However your Bard Song becomes stronger (2 attack/2 damage vs 1/1) and you might be able to do something with spells.

Divine Power: the BAB will change to max, which means the AB will change (by 1 assuming <5 Bard levels in the builds). It cannot get WS/EWS, but it does have (the unfortunately short-lived) Divine Favor.

As for Zen Archery, you still need Dex 13 for Rapid Shot and I doubt that Plate is giving you as much AC as you get from Dex.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Haven't read the whole thread but I wanted to mention something here quickly,
The Divine Power's AB boost is counted within the +20 cap limit on AB, so effectively if you have a +20 weapon & do this you gain nothing!
From the NwN Wiki,
"The increase in base attack bonus is a simulation, so the increase counts towards the +20 attack bonus cap."

So, if you are on a high-magic module or anything, take that into consideration guys,
Have fun

posts.author: Mick Dagger

The Enchant Arrow based AB increase does not count towards the AB bonus cap of +20.
When you start picking other classes for whatnot benefits, my advice is to keep track of how much EA based AB and damage you lose in the process.

Hey Cornflower, nice to see you here as well.

By going bard 3 at the end you gained Tumble, Spellcraft, and UMD but lose 4 damage from EWS.

I opted to take fighter at level 21 for EWS, with only 1 level in wizard. Given the apparant lack of multiclass penalties (or party size penalties for that matter) on BSk you can go Elf with your build scott free, so that might be the better choice.

I guess you could give up +1 on arrows for EWS and skill dumps both, dropping AA to 27 and going Fighter 10 / Bard 3. But if max AB is what you're after then it's a loss. So I would say your build is done.
